Package br.com.ufs.iotaframework.iota

Class IoTA

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.ufs.iotaframework.iota.IoTA
  • public class IoTA
extends java.lang.Object
    IoTA covers IoT-Agent operations provisioning. Your objective is to let a bit easier to developer do FIWARE applications using java.
    Since:
    1.0

      • IoTA

        public IoTA​(java.lang.String ip,
            int port)
        Creates a IoTA object.
        Parameters:
        ip - An IP address from where the IoTA is running.
        port - An port from where the IoTA is running.

      • IoTA

        public IoTA​(java.lang.String ip,
            int port,
            java.lang.String device_url,
            java.lang.String resource,
            java.lang.String apikey)
        Parameters:
        ip - ip An IP address from where the IoTA is running.
        port - port An port from where the IoTA is running.
        device_url - a url where the measures are sended.
        resource - the resource endpoint.
        apikey - the apikey for authenticate measures sended.

      • createService

        public void createService​(ServiceGroup serviceGroup)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a service group
        Parameters:
        serviceGroup - An given object representing the service group. The object follows the JSON entity representation format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        ServiceGroup

      • retrieveService

        public ServiceGroup retrieveService​(int limit,
                                    int offset,
                                    java.lang.String resource)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieve a subservice or all subservices.
        Parameters:
        limit - In order to specify the maximum number of services (default is 20, maximum allowed is 1000).
        offset - In order to skip a given number of elements at the beginning (default is 0).
        resource - URI for the iotagent, return only services for this iotagent.
        Returns:
        a Service Group instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        ServiceGroup

      • retrieveAllServices

        public ServiceGroup retrieveAllServices()
        Retrieve all subservices.
        Returns:
        a Service Group instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        ServiceGroup

      • updateService

        public void updateService​(java.lang.String apikey,
                          java.lang.String resource,
                          Service service)
        If you want modify only a field, it's allowed. You cannot modify an element into an array field, but whole array. ("/*" is not allowed).
        Parameters:
        apikey - If you don't specify, apikey=" " is applied.
        resource - URI for service into iotagent.
        service - a service object representing the update
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        ServiceGroup

      • removeService

        public void removeService​(java.lang.String apikey,
                          java.lang.String resource)
        You remove a subservice into a service. If Fiware-ServicePath is '/*' or '/#' remove service and all subservices.
        Parameters:
        apikey - If you don't specify, apikey=" " is applied.
        resource - URI for service into iotagent. Remove devices in service/subservice. This parameter is not valid when Fiware-ServicePath is '/*' or '/#'.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        ServiceGroup

      • updateDevice

        public void updateDevice​(java.lang.String device_id,
                         Device device)
        Given a device id, update a device. If you want modify only a field, you can do it, except field protocol (this field, if provided it is removed from request).
        Parameters:
        device_id - An id from device.
        device - an object representing the update.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        DeviceList

      • removeDevice

        public void removeDevice​(java.lang.String device_id)
        Given a device id, delete a device. If specific device is not found, we work as deleted.
        Parameters:
        device_id - An id from device.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        DeviceList

      • sendMeasure

        public void sendMeasure​(java.lang.String url,
                        java.lang.String resource,
                        java.lang.String apikey,
                        java.lang.String device_id,
                        java.lang.String payload)
        This operation send devices measures.
        Parameters:
        apikey - An apikey used for validate the measure was sent.
        device_id - An id from device.
        payload - a text payload using http ultralight sintax.
        url - a url (ip + port)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for http requests (bad request, forbidden, etc.)
        See Also:
        DeviceList

      • sendMeasure

        public void sendMeasure​(java.lang.String device_id,
                        java.lang.String payload)
        This operation send devices measures.
        Parameters:
        device_id - An id from device.
        payload - a text payload using http ultralight sintax.

      • shoWDebug

        public void shoWDebug​(java.lang.String json)
        This operation show on console a JSON file to debug purposes. To use this feature, you only need to set the debugMode attribute to true on orion.
        Parameters:
        json - a JSON to be showed on screen, to debug purposes.

      • showStackTrace

        public void showStackTrace​(java.lang.Exception e)
        This operation show on console the stack trace. To use this feature, you only need to set the debugMode attribute to true on orion.
        Parameters:
        e - a exception to show your stack trace on console.
